symptoms: Central AC not cooling properly; runs continuously but house temperature won't drop below 78°F when set to 72°F; condenser running but quieter than usual; no ice; serviced 6 months ago; energy bills increased.

root_cause_hypotheses.evidence: Refrigerant 'a bit low' 6 months ago; increased energy bills suggest reduced efficiency.
Condenser running quieter than usual; inefficient cooling.

most_likely_cause: The most likely cause is a refrigerant leak leading to low refrigerant levels and inefficient cooling.

recommended_actions.step: Inspect refrigerant lines and components for leaks using electronic leak detector and bubble solution.
recommended_actions.why: To identify and locate the source of refrigerant leak.

recommended_actions.step: Repair any identified leaks by sealing or replacing damaged components.
recommended_actions.why: To prevent further refrigerant loss and restore system efficiency.

recommended_actions.step: Evacuate the system and recharge with the correct type and amount of refrigerant per manufacturer's specifications.
recommended_actions.why: To ensure optimal system performance and prevent overcharging or undercharging.

recommended_actions.step: Monitor system pressures and temperatures after recharge to verify proper operation.
recommended_actions.why: To confirm the system is cooling efficiently and identify any remaining issues.

recommended_actions.step: If no leaks are found, test compressor performance and efficiency.
recommended_actions.why: To rule out a failing compressor.

recommended_actions.step: Inspect blower motor and coil for restrictions.

tools_parts: Replacement refrigerant line(s) or valve(s) (if needed)
safety_notes: Wear appropriate personal protective equipment (PPE), including gloves and eye protection, when handling refrigerant.
Refrigerant can cause frostbite. Avoid contact with skin and eyes.
Ensure proper ventilation when working with refrigerant.
Recover refrigerant properly according to EPA regulations.
Disconnect power to the unit before beginning any repairs.

confidence.assessment: Confidence is adequate that a refrigerant leak is the primary cause of the issue.

customer_readiness_check.short_reason: Clear steps, cost/time provided, safety notes included, and confidence threshold met; refrigerant leak most likely.
